form.instruction:
You need to make sure the articles in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Art. Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have articles marked with the category Art in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If articles are mixed in with another category in the lexicon, you either need to give them the category Art in your morphological parser, or add the feature makeArt to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax.
If you have articles marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Art, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Art.
Art

You need to make sure the demonstratives in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Dem. Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have demonstratives marked with the category Dem in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If demonstratives are mixed in with another category in the lexicon, you either need to give them the category Dem in your morphological parser, or add the feature makeDem to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax.
If you have demonstratives marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Dem, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Dem.
Dem

instruction.p: Run the file adjtest.txt through your morphological parser and then run the syntactic parser on the output. Check the log browser for the results and note any changes you need to make to the lexicon or to answers about the order of elements in the phrase structure rules. Make the changes as needed and rerun.
Please check off this section now in 'Contents' and then proceed to the Simple and Possessed Nominal Phrases section when you are ready.
